> " Uh ohh, I - think I lost my sonar transmitter someplace.. Hmm, must hav=
e gotten destroyed in the heat of the fight. Too bad, because that was - th=
e only link I had to the - Ark. Being sight impaired finding my way is next=
 to - near impossible. Wow, you - sure got me good this time. How unfortuna=
te... All that power, lost in an unknown area of this planet, with no way o=
f locating it. I'm sorry, but without that device, I can not find the Ark l=
et alone see anything in front of my face."
>
> He gave up the information =
he knew he could give to them safely. The rest he keeps quiet.

Scorponok c=
huckled darkly, his voice sounding far more deep and
resonant than Zarak's =
did. "You think we need the location of the
Ark?" he asked as he reached up=
 with a clawed hand to lightly tap on
Tuscon's helm, running the blade of t=
he claw along it, "It's not the
location that we need, it's the specificati=
on, your understanding of
it."

Scorponok looked over at the torture contro=
ls and then back at Tuscon,
"And believe me, you will reveal it to us, in f=
act, you will be
begging to tell us everything you know." Scorponok intoned=
, his voice
if anything deeper and more threatening. "And then, if I'm feel=
ing
indulgent, I will be ready to listen."

Preston
